skill.name: Voice Agent Expert ‚Äì Debugging Cheat Sheet (Skill)
skill.description: This skill is a practical, "use-it-while-debugging" reference for getting a LiveKit + Letta voice agent working reliably.
skill.summary: This skill is a practical, "use-it-while-debugging" reference for getting a LiveKit + Letta voice ag...
skill.author: EGAdams

security_audit.summary: This skill provides diagnostic and management tools for Letta voice agent systems. It performs legitimate system checks and service management. The scripts only access necessary environment variables and use standard subprocess calls for system diagnostics.

low_findings.title: Hardcoded absolute paths in scripts
low_findings.description: Scripts contain hardcoded absolute paths specific to the author's system (/home/adamsl/planner, /home/adamsl/ottomator-agents). This limits portability and could cause confusion if users try to run these scripts on different systems.

content.value_statement: Voice conversations with AI agents often fail due to duplicate processes and mode mismatches. This skill provides instant diagnostics and automated fixes for Letta voice agent systems.
actual_capabilities: Diagnose complete voice agent system health
Detect and prevent duplicate voice agent processes
Start voice services with proper dependency checking
Check environment variables and API keys
limitations: Requires specific Letta and LiveKit setup
Only works with Python-based voice agents
Needs manual service startup for some components

use_cases.title: Debug voice agent timeouts
use_cases.description: Quickly identify why your Letta voice agent isn't responding or timing out during conversations.

use_cases.title: Automate voice service startup
use_cases.description: Start voice services in correct order with dependency checks and duplicate prevention.

use_cases.title: Fix audio cutting issues
use_cases.description: Resolve intermittent audio problems caused by duplicate voice agent processes.

prompt_templates.title: Basic diagnostics
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a full diagnostic on my Letta voice agent system and tell me what's wrong

prompt_templates.title: Generate connection token
prompt_templates.scenario: Need to connect to voice agent
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a new LiveKit token for connecting to my voice agent

prompt_templates.title: Start voice services
prompt_templates.prompt: Start my voice agent system with all required services in the correct order

prompt_templates.title: Emergency restart
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete restart of my voice agent system, killing any stuck processes

output_examples.input: Why is my voice agent timing out?
output: ‚úÖ Letta server is RUNNING on port 8283
‚úÖ Livekit server is RUNNING on port 7880
Fix: Run restart script to kill duplicates and start fresh

best_practices: Always use dev mode for local testing, never start mode
Check for duplicate processes before troubleshooting
Use diagnostic script first to identify root cause
anti_patterns: Starting voice agent directly without dependency checks
Using start mode for local development instead of dev mode
Ignoring duplicate process warnings in system logs

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Letta versions?
faq.answer: Designed for Letta with LiveKit integration. Requires specific voice agent setup with WebRTC support.

faq.question: What are the system requirements?
faq.answer: Requires Letta server (port 8283), LiveKit server (port 7880), and Python voice agent with proper environment variables.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing voice setup?
faq.answer: Scripts use hardcoded paths that need adjustment. Modify environment file locations for your system.

faq.question: Is my API key data safe?
faq.answer: Scripts only read existing environment files. No data is transmitted or stored externally.

faq.question: Voice still cuts out after using scripts
faq.answer: Check browser WebSocket connections and microphone permissions. Ensure single voice agent process is running.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual troubleshooting?
faq.answer: Automates common fixes like duplicate detection and service startup order, saving hours of manual debugging.
